content.question: The rate, in calories per minute, at which a person using an exercise machine burns calories is modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@36DF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. In the figure above, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@36DF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is piecewise linear for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find f'(22). Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: The rate, in calories per minute, at which a person using an exercise machine burns calories is modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@36DF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. In the figure above, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mn>3</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@36DF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is piecewise linear for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find f'(22). Indicate units of measure.

(b) For the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, at what time <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacaWG0baaaa@370D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacaWGMbaaaa@36FF@</annotation> </semantics> </math> increasing at its greatest rate? Show the reasoning that supports your answer.
(c) Find the total number of calories burned over the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn> 6  </mn> <mo> ≤  </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤  </mo> <mn> 18 </mn> </mrow> </math> minutes.

(d) The setting on the machine is now changed so that the person burns f(t) + c calories per minute. For this setting, find c so that an average of 15 calories per minute is burned during the time interval 6 ≤ t ≤ 18.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
